[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Related Key Attacks] Can attackers exploit relationships between ElGamal keys used by different validators to mount related-key attacks and compromise multiple validators simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Homomorphic Property Abuse] Can attackers abuse ElGamal's homomorphic properties to manipulate encrypted validator votes or consensus messages without detection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Key Substitution] Can an attacker substitute their public key for a validator's legitimate key during protocol execution, intercepting and decrypting confidential messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Adaptive Attack] Can attackers mount adaptive chosen-ciphertext attacks by observing validator behavior across multiple epochs to extract private keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Quantum Attacks] Does ElGamal over elliptic curves provide post-quantum security, or will quantum computers enable key recovery and decryption of historical Aptos data? (Low - future concern)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Batch Decryption] If validators batch-decrypt multiple ciphertexts, can correlation between decryptions leak key material or enable cross-decryption attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Zero-Knowledge Proofs] Without zero-knowledge proofs of correct encryption, can attackers submit invalid ciphertexts forcing validators into inconsistent states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Threshold Decryption] If ElGamal is used for threshold decryption among validators, are shares properly protected from malicious coalition attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Forward Secrecy] Does the ElGamal implementation provide forward secrecy, or can compromise of current keys expose historical encrypted communications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Cross-Protocol Attacks] Can ElGamal keys used in Aptos be attacked by exploiting interactions with other protocols or cryptographic schemes in the ecosystem? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Maximum Scalar Value] What happens if a scalar equal to the group order is used - does this cause wrap-around or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Identity Element Operations] Can encrypting or decrypting the identity element cause special-case failures or leak information about keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Generator as Message] What security properties hold if the group generator itself is encrypted - can this enable attacks on the encryption scheme? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Self-Encryption] Can encrypting a public key to itself create circular dependencies or enable attacks on validator key management? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Large Batch Operations] Can processing large batches of ElGamal operations cause memory exhaustion or integer overflow in validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Concurrent Key Generation] Can concurrent calls to key_gen from multiple threads cause RNG state corruption or generate duplicate keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Empty or Null Inputs] How does the API handle empty, null, or uninitialized group elements - can this cause undefined behavior or security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Very Large Messages] Can encrypting very large messages (close to group size) cause overflow or wrap-around issues in the encryption scheme? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Protocol] [Deterministic Encryption] Does ElGamal provide deterministic encryption, and if so, can this enable distinguishing attacks on encrypted validator communications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Protocol] [IND-CCA2 Security] Does the ElGamal implementation achieve IND-CCA2 security, or is it vulnerable to adaptive chosen-ciphertext attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Protocol] [Authenticated Encryption] Does ElGamal include authentication, or can attackers modify ciphertexts without detection causing state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Protocol] [Key Confirmation] Is there a key confirmation step to verify public keys are correctly derived from private keys, preventing weak key injection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Protocol] [Binding to Context] Are ciphertexts cryptographically bound to specific contexts (validator, epoch, round), or can they be replayed across contexts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Protocol] [Domain Separation] Does the implementation use domain separation to prevent cross-protocol attacks when ElGamal is used for multiple purposes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Unsafe Code] Does the ElGamal implementation contain any unsafe code blocks that could introduce memory safety vulnerabilities? (High)
